name: Donald Trump
biography: Donald Trump is the 45th and 47th President of the United States, making history as the second U.S. president to serve non-consecutive terms. He won the 2024 election against Kamala Harris and was inaugurated in January 2025. His second term has been marked by significant policy shifts, including increased tariffs and executive actions.

name: Giorgia Meloni
biography: Giorgia Meloni is the first female Prime Minister of Italy, leading a right-wing coalition government since 2022. She is known for her nationalist and conservative policies.

name: Joe Biden
biography: Joe Biden served as the 46th President of the United States from 2021 until 2025. He withdrew from the 2024 presidential race and endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris, who lost to Donald Trump.

name: Xi Jinping
biography: Xi Jinping is the president of China and the General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party.

name: Vladimir Putin
biography: Vladimir Putin is the president of Russia, having held various high offices in the country since 1999.

name: Emmanuel Macron
biography: Emmanuel Macron is the president of France and a former investment banker and civil servant.

name: Volodymyr Zelenskyy
biography: Volodymyr Zelenskyy is the President of Ukraine, first elected in 2019. A former comedian and media figure, he gained international prominence during the ongoing conflict with Russia, advocating for military aid, international sanctions, and EU/NATO integration.

name: Narendra Modi
biography: Narendra Modi is the prime minister of India and a prominent leader of the Bharatiya Janata Party.

name: Boris Johnson
biography: Boris Johnson served as the prime minister of the United Kingdom and was a key figure in the Brexit campaign.

name: Shinzo Abe
biography: Shinzo Abe was Japan's longest-serving prime minister and played a key role in economic and defense policies.

name: Jacinda Ardern
biography: Jacinda Ardern served as the prime minister of New Zealand and gained international recognition for her leadership style.
Angela Dorothea Merkel is a German politician and scientist who served as the chancellor of Germany.
name: Angela Merkel
Jair Bolsonaro
biography: Jair Bolsonaro is a former president of Brazil known for his far-right political views and controversial statements.

name: Justin Trudeau
biography: Justin Trudeau served as Canada's Prime Minister from 2015 until 2025. He resigned and was succeeded by Mark Carney following the Liberal Party's win in the 2025 election.

name: Andrés Manuel López Obrador
biography: Andrés Manuel López Obrador served as President of Mexico from 2018 to 2024. He did not seek re-election and was succeeded by Claudia Sheinbaum.

name: Fumio Kishida
biography: Fumio Kishida served as Prime Minister of Japan from 2021 until 2024. He stepped down as LDP leader, prompting the selection of a new prime minister.

name: Pedro Sánchez
biography: Pedro Sánchez is the prime minister of Spain and has led a coalition government since 2018.

name: Olaf Scholz
biography: Olaf Scholz served as Chancellor of Germany from 2021 until early 2025. He was succeeded by Friedrich Merz following the federal elections.

name: Yoon Suk-yeol
biography: Yoon Suk-yeol served as President of South Korea from 2022 until his impeachment and removal from office in April 2025. A special election is scheduled for June 2025.

name: Recep Tayyip Erdoğan
biography: Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has been the president of Turkey since 2014, following a long tenure as prime minister.

name: Rishi Sunak
biography: Rishi Sunak is the prime minister of the United Kingdom, previously serving as Chancellor of the Exchequer.

name: Alexander De Croo
biography: Alexander De Croo served as Prime Minister of Belgium from 2020 until 2024. He remained in a caretaker role until early 2025, when a new coalition was formed.

name: Mark Rutte
party: People's Party for Freedom and Democracy
biography: Mark Rutte served as Prime Minister of the Netherlands from 2010 to 2024 before being appointed as NATO Secretary General, focusing on transatlantic security and defense cooperation.

name: Anthony Albanese
biography: Anthony Albanese is the 31st Prime Minister of Australia, leading the Labor Party to victory in 2022. His administration focuses on climate change, healthcare, and social equity.

name: Ursula von der Leyen
biography: Ursula von der Leyen is the first female President of the European Commission, leading initiatives on digital transformation, climate policy, and EU integration.

name: Sanna Marin
biography: Sanna Marin served as Prime Minister of Finland from 2019 to 2023, becoming the world's youngest serving state leader at the time. She is known for her progressive policies and leadership during the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Leo Varadkar
biography: Leo Varadkar is the Taoiseach of Ireland, having served two non-consecutive terms. He is the first openly gay Irish head of government and has focused on economic growth and social reforms.

name: Mette Frederiksen
biography: Mette Frederiksen is Denmark's youngest-ever Prime Minister, known for her leadership on climate policy, social welfare, and handling of the COVID-19 crisis.

name: Kaja Kallas
biography: Kaja Kallas is the first female Prime Minister of Estonia, focusing on digital innovation, cybersecurity, and strengthening EU and NATO ties.

name: Katrín Jakobsdóttir
biography: Katrín Jakobsdóttir is the Prime Minister of Iceland, known for her progressive policies on environmental issues, gender equality, and education reform.
